alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Orange; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 5:54PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Seminole, east central Lake, northwestern Orange and western Volusia Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 552 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near DeBary, moving north at 10 mph. Other strong storms will develop over western Orange county. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Deltona, Sanford, Apopka, Altamonte Springs and Eustis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!

area.areaDesc: Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Orange; Seminole
